docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

I like to drink after playing

docs.title: Admonitions
docs.text:
Example of an admonition/callout with a title:

Title of the callout

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa.

Collapsible callout

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla et euismod nulla. Curabitur feugiat, tortor non consequat finibus, justo purus auctor massa, nec semper lorem quam in massa.

Tip

Nothing in here.

success, question, warning, failure ...

docs.title: Code example
docs.text:
An example of a codeblock of Python:

add_numbers.py
# Function to add two numbers
def add_two_numbers(num1, num2):
    return num1 + num2

#Example Usage
result = add_two_numbers(1,2)
print('The sum is:', result)
concatenate_strings.js
// Function to concatenate two strings
function concatenateStrings(str1, str2) {
    return str1 + str2;
}
// Example usage
const result = concatenateStrings("Hello,", "World!");
console.log("The concatenated string is:",
result);

docs.text:
Plain textUnordered listOrdered list

docs.title: Code Blocks in Content Tabs
Flowcharts
docs.text:
graph LR
    A[Start] --> B{Failure?};
    B -->|Yes| C[Investigate...];
    C --> D[Debug];
    D --> B;
    B ----> |No| E[Success!];

docs.title: Sequence Diagrams
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    autonumber
    Server->>Terminal: Send request
    loop Health
        Terminal->>Terminal: Check for health
    end
    Note right of Terminal: System online
    Terminal-->>Server: Everything is OK
    Terminal->>Database: Request customer data
    Database-->>Terminal: Customer data
